body:
Hmm, so that error window most likely means that the webview2 installation failed.
No idea if it was tauris install script or yours (main.wxs) as it should try to run both scripts (because skipWebviewInstall is disabled).
But i also have no idea about wix, just trying to give you a hint to where it fails :/
Seems like we need an alternative for Windows 7 since powershell isn't available.
Let's see if https://github.com/MicrosoftEdge/WebView2Samples/blob/master/SampleApps/WV2DeploymentWiXBurnBundleSample/Bundle.wxs approach fixes it.

Can you see if this installs correctly on Windows 7? It's an alternative approach using the Tauri API example. @charmfocus 
[installer.zip](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/files/7534005/installer.zip)

Maybe my win7 VM is broken again (it shouldn't as it's a somewhat fresh install), but i get:
"Setup Failed
One or more issues caused the setup to fail. Please fix the issues and then retry setup. For more information see the [log file](https://pastebin.com/BLX2h9xD)
`0x80072f7d - Unknown Error`"

This is the same issue some people had in discord with the powershell script, where it didn't use TLS(1.2). for example the discussion around this message: https://discord.com/channels/616186924390023171/731495064508825731/882219386600034376

So i had to go to `Internet Options -> Advanced` and check the `Use TLS 1.2` option.
After that the installation works fine...
Well at least I know I can finish this approach and PR it.

> Can you see if this installs correctly on Windows 7? It's an alternative approach using the Tauri API example. @charmfocus [installer.zip](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/files/7534005/installer.zip)

Turn off the safety anti-virus sofware and install successfully

[Tauri API_0.1.0_x64.exe.zip](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/files/7534219/Tauri.API_0.1.0_x64.exe.zip)

What about this one? This installer doesn't download the `MicrosoftEdgeWebview2Setup.exe` file, but has it embedded.

> [Tauri API_0.1.0_x64.exe.zip](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/files/7534219/Tauri.API_0.1.0_x64.exe.zip)
> 
> What about this one? This installer doesn't download the `MicrosoftEdgeWebview2Setup.exe` file, but has it embedded.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/209699/141691154-64bce00d-2d2a-4c2c-9734-89cb9b52afef.png)
When the antivirus software is not closed, the installation fails `Access denied`

The log:
```
[1130:031C][2021-11-15T01:13:09]i001: Burn v3.11.2.4516, Windows v6.1 (Build 7601: Service Pack 1), path: C:\Windows\Temp\{040D03D6-D4F2-4044-B8F7-222AA3E7337F}\.cr\Tauri API_0.1.0_x64.exe

[0B9C:10A8][2021-11-15T01:13:18]i320: Registering bundle dependency provider: {62b0971d-cd7f-4a97-bee9-dc5ed29b2884}, version: 0.1.0.0
[0B9C:10A8][2021-11-15T01:13:18]i371: Updating session, registration key: SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\{62b0971d-cd7f-4a97-bee9-dc5ed29b2884}, resume: Active, restart initiated: No, disable resume: No

[1130:031C][2021-11-15T01:13:18]i399: Apply complete, result: 0x80070005, restart: None, ba requested restart:  No

```

For what it's worth, this one works without enabling TLS1.2 (which seems to be disabled by default pre-win10).
The app itself still crashes tho. Kinda unrelated to this gh issue, but the error is:
```
thread 'main' panicked at 'error while building tauri application:
Runtime<CreateWebview<WebView2Error<WindowsError<Error < code: 0x80070057, message: "Wrong Parameter.", win32_error: 87 >>>>>',
src\main.rs:200:6
```
edit: forgot to add it here, but the crash was transparency related, sorry bout that.
I have no idea what's going on with the antivirus and the webview installer.
The error is happening on this function call: https://docs.rs/webview2-com/latest/webview2_com/Microsoft/Web/WebView2/Win32/struct.ICoreWebView2Controller2.html#method.SetDefaultBackgroundColor

issue.title: fix: ignore transparency on Windows 7

issue.title: Papercut fails to open or show up in tray

repository.name: Papercut-SMTP
repository.description: Papercut SMTP -- The Simple Desktop Email Server

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When opening Papercut, no UI or tray icon appears, making it impossible to use.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open Papercut.exe
2. Process is running, but no UI or tray icon appears
3. Log file indicates an error, and the only way to exit Papercut is to force close the process in Task Manager.

**Expected behavior**
1. Open Papercut.exe
2. A UI window or tray icon appears

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10 Pro
 - Version 1909 (OS Build 18363.836)

**Additional context**

Log file:


issue.title: [bug] The standard Windows installation has bad UX for installing WebView2 as a dependency

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

See the video below for why I'm ringing the bell about this:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3120639/174429998-b17eb281-c50a-49a9-9118-4193be949678.mp4

When installing a standard Tauri application when the user does not have webview2 installed, the installer behaves like a malware-ridden installer.

The wix installer needs to be made to make it synchronous.

This was previously talked about in https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/2452#issuecomment-918291043

It recently got a reply in the discord:

> 1) Personally i prefer a non-quiet installation
> 2) UAC is not an issue anymore because ms added support for installing it with just user permissions
> 3) i still agree that running the wv2 installer at the end/after the app installation is too late
> ...
> it's indeed quite some time ago already so i'm not 100% sure, but i think we don't even need to use powershell but could use wix' ExePackage instead.
> Unless setting tls1.2 in powershell works even if its not enabled system wide, because that would fix the installer on win7. and changing this setting for exepackage is not possible afaik.

https://discord.com/channels/616186924390023171/731495028677148753/985618974882541578

but needs some action taken on it.

If there's discussion on how it should be implemented, I'm happy to send a PR. My personal opinions on how it should work don't match that of the Tauri WG, so I'm not going to do it without some information, but I'm happy to do cross-testing for 7, 10 and 11 to make sure the results work and is a pleasant installation experience, as long as the parameters are laid out.

### Reproduction

1. Build a standard tauri application
2. Remove Webview2 to cause the installer to install it for you
3. Install your build, watch it behave in a creepy fashion

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Platform and versions

```shell
Windows pre-11, no WebView2 installed.
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: [bug] Windows Installer package on Windows 7 32-bit

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I am testing tauri on Windows 7 32-bit.
After generating the release in a Windows 11 64-bit machine with
`tauri build --target i686-pc-windows-msvc`
and executing the .msi in a 32-bit win7 machine, I got the error bellow.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31071765/175611553-37e2ae52-0821-43fd-a3f1-5c993c0d9ab6.png)


### Reproduction

_No response_

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Platform and versions

```shell
Environment
   OS: Windows 10.0.22000 X64
   Webview2: 102.0.1245.44
   MSVC: 
      - Visual Studio Build Tools 2019
      - Visual Studio Community 2022
   Node.js: 16.15.1
   npm: 8.12.2
   pnpm: Not installed!
   yarn: 1.22.19
   rustup: 1.24.3
   rustc: 1.61.0
   cargo: 1.61.0
   Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc 

Packages
   @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 1.0.0
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

body:
Updating the related #4461 issue.
After manually installing the Microsoft Edge WebView2 Runtime, my installer worked.
